an10.89:15.3: The measure here is the _khārika_. Assuming smaller horses and less agile carts, a single horse in those days might draw a fully laden cart of around 500 kg. Divide by 20 makes 25 kg, which is roughly a bushel. Since a single sesamum weighs about 0.003 grams, taking one every 100 years yields about 17 billion years. The current estimate of the age of the universe in physics is estimated at 13.8 billion years.
an10.89:15.4: Ten hells are listed here, the names of which do not correspond with the 21 or 28 listed in Purāṇas, nor with the seven Jain hells, nor with the hells of [mn130](). The commentary offers three explanations for the obscure names of these hells: they are numbers reflecting the duration spent in Avīci; or they are the cries uttered by those suffering there; or they are simply the cold hells.
